headline: Best No-Bake Cherry Cheesecake
description: This no-bake cherry cheesecake has a graham cracker crust and an easy cherry pie filling spread over top. It's delicious and will delight everyone in the family!

video.description: A light and creamy cheesecake that requires no baking!
video.name: The Best Unbaked Cherry Cheesecake Ever

name: Best No-Bake Cherry Cheesecake
recipeIngredient: 1 (12.5 ounce) can cherry pie filling (or other filling of your choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together graham cracker crumbs, margarine, and sugar for crust in a bowl until well incorporated and crumbly. Press mixture into a 9-inch pie plate, going up the sides as much as possible.
Beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla for filling in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and spreadable.
Beat cream in a chilled glass or metal bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Fold into cream cheese mixture until smooth.
Pour filling into the prepared crust, and smooth the top with a spatula. Refrigerate until firm, about 2 to 3 hours.
Spread cherry pie filling over the chilled cheesecake. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving.

review.reviewBody: yes did add 1/2cup cheese I just love the thick texture ðŸ‘Œthank's so much
Good recipe. I saw another and like this one better. One thing I always do is add a touch of oats and very small amount of cinnamon to crust. Really makes a difference to me.

Such a good recipe and so simple. Everyone loves it! I also agree with doubling the filling. You don't have to double the crust but do make a little more than this recipe calls for. I make it in a spring form pan and it calls for a larger amount of the ingredients. Be sure to put cheesecake in the frig while still in the spring form pan. It comes out of it much easier when very cold.

I used individual sugar cookies as a substitute for the crust to take to work. Everyone RAVED and wanted the recipe. I did add almond flavoring instead of vanilla and used a mixer to break up the whole cherries in the pie filling. Next time I might use blueberry or peach pie filling to change it up

So yummy and fluffy and sweet! I found it even more delicious, and so much easier, than baked cheesecake. The crust turned out a little crumbly for me, so maybe Iâ€™ll try more butter next time, or look for a different crust recipe. Still tasted delicious though!
I love this!! I used baked tart shells and sprinkled the cheesecake tarts with cocoa and cinnamon I didn't even need to chill them before eating. It was a hit with everyone!!
Easy a very good, but I recommend doubling up on the cream cheese filling. I did and it was the perfect amount. So double the cream cheese, icing sugar, vanilla, and whip cream. Enjoy!
Awesome recipe! Exactly how I used to make it! Delicious
This recipe was easy to come together and family loved it.
I really like it but I might just be the pan I used but definitely put something to help it not stick
Good and easy enough to do, even for novices.
Added a few raspberries in the filling then mashed the rest adding when it was served. Doubled recipe my son's fav

I have made this recipe twice. The first time I found it to sweet and rich. Not really good for a Diabetic "cheat night". The 2nd time I made it; I used light cream cheese and the light cool whip . I used the same measurements as the recipe calls for. It worked out real well. No to sweet or rich, it has been asked for many times since and I have passed my adpations on to others.
Did no changes and made it two weekends in a row. It was so good
Easy to follow directions and so yummy!!!!

There were 2 recipes that called for what I had on hand. I went with this recipe, because I thought the one that called for sweetened condensed milk would be too sweet.
I used a store bought graham cracker crust.
Nice creamy texture and perfectly sweet. 
Just follow the recipe and you wonâ€™t be disappointed.
Yummy! I did use 1/2 cup of crushed Cheerios's and 3/4 cups graham cracker crumbs. I also made them in individual cupcake liners. Made 13
Needed more seasoning and I added onions as well. I also served hollandaise sauce on the side.

This no bake cheesecake is great for those extremely hot days. The best part is you can change the toppings to whatever you like. I used mandarin orange slices, sliced strawberries and even chocolate chips.
Deliciously fluffy. Seriously, it's hard to share

Great recipe!! I consider this a quick and easy "basic" cheesecake. The varieties one could create are endless. I used gluten free graham crackers for my crust and, as others recommend, 1/4 cup lemon juice. I also swirled seedless raspberry jam throughout instead of cherry. May add cocoa or oreos next time.

Great flavour, more of a mousse than cheesecake texture-wise, highly recommend adding 2Tbsp of lemon juice or it could be very sweet. Next time I make this will probably double the filling because it didn't make a lot
It was nothing more then a soupy mess this. Recipe is terrible and is nothing what it states to be
Super easy and super delicious!

It's just as the title states... THE BEST.

So easy, so straightforward, so tasty. It's my go-to for company or when I want to do something special for a friend.
I took note from another in comments added only3/4 cup icing sugar. It's setting now but the spoon taste test was delicious.
Great cheesecake....hubby loved it
The cheese filling was never fluffy enough despite mixing the cheese filling for 5 min. It tasted excellent otherwise.

Excellent cheesecake. I had to improvise as we are camping and no confectioners sugar and then I decided I wanted to do cheesecake 3 ways (3 recipes) and had to work with three 8 x 12 foil pans with plastic lids. I added 1 tbsp of corn starch for each cup of sugar in the cream cheese mixture and used 3 1/2 cups of cream for the triple recipe. I added the extra 1/2 cup of cream for a little more volume as my pans were bigger than suggested. We had graham bottom with cheery pie filling topping, graham bottom with homemade raspberry sauce and finally a chocolate wafer crust with chocolate syrup drizzled on top. They were a big hit with our guests.
Great recipe ! Easy to whip up too ! I served mine with fresh strawberries.

I love this recipe. It is so easy but decadent! I did not have Cherry Pie filling so cooked and thickened some frozen blueberries for the topping. Yum. Have used the cherries in the past and that is delicious also.
Delicious. I put cooked fresh blueberries on top and used pre-made graham cracker crust.

I read other comments about this being to sweet so I used on 1/2 cup of powered sugar. I also read some reviews stating there pie did not set well so I folded the whip cream in gently I also used cool whip instead of whipping cream. The pie turned out amazing everyone loved it

So yummy and good. Sweetness of the cheese part is perfect. I topped mine with fresh berries mixed with a little sugar. Perfect for a hot summer evening dessert.
I used a pre made graham cracker crust pie shell, so it was even easier and quickly made.
Way too sweet. My grandkids eats lot of sugar . They said it was too sweet. And grandson got a headache and I felt sick. I'm stick to another recipe.Too much icing sugar
Perfect no changes

I always loved this recipe 
It is a big hit at family dinners 
I add a teaspoon of lemon juice to the cream cheese mixture. It gives it a little refreshing kick
Easy, fast, delicious!

I doubled the ingredients and put it into a 9x13 pan, otherwise followed the recipe exactly. It turned out great, cut up very nicely! I had an older recipe that I made with cool whip topping but the whipped cream in this recipe is WAY better! Made again for a party, finishing it without topping and had cherry pie filling, crushed pineapple and blueberry pie filling on the side so guests could choose their own! Perfect... it's a winner recipe!
The cheesecake was really good. I did cut the sugar in half for the filling. The crust was good but really crumbly.

This was my first time trying to make cheesecake, so I thought an unbaked version would be a good place to start. I was giving it as a gift to my brother. The cheesecake itself tasted fine, but the crust would not hold together. It completely crumbled into a pile of dust, even after leaving it in the fridge overnight!! I had even snuck in a tiny bit of extra margarine, but it obviously didn't help. I was sooo embarrassed!!

love this recipe! Important to whip the cream then fold it into the cream cheese mixture. Also added some cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice into graham crumb mixture to add a bit of flavor. I also add some real lemon into cream cheese mixture. my family loves it. I have to double as I have a big family
Very easy to make and take. Haven't tried it yet but if just the filling by itself is any indication it should be awesome!!!
Very good recipe :)
So easy and so good! Fluffier than my mom's which was my favorite before this! Really good on a pre-made gluten free crust too!
Super easy, super quic, super yummy.. I did add just a squeeze of fresh lemon juice..
Will definitely make it again. I found if left overnight in the refrigerator everything sets up nicely.
It turned out awesome!!! Fast and easy... will be making this again....

For the crust instead of using sugar I use brown sugar the crust stays together, packs easier and moist. Instead of heavy whipping cream I use 1 tub frozen whipped cream lite dethawed. I have made this same recipe about 8x's with perfect luck and never a drop left... Everyone loves this! Topped with blueberry pie filling and add fresh blueberries from the fruit section small container, sometimes will use cherry pie filling have also used the sweet pie filling add fresh strawberries any one is a treat anytime of the year. I also have done double batch in cake pan half cherry on top half blueberry that way everyone gets their FAC.
very good easy

This is my go-to dessert! It's so easy to make, doubles easily and always turns out great!!! My husband is diabetic so I substitute Stevia for the white sugar and reduce the amount of icing sugar by about 1/3 of a cup. My family loves it with raspberry pie fill for a topping but I have also made it with fresh strawberries and it was awesome!
It took a lot longer to set than expected, but everything else turned out good.
I used gingerbread cookie crumbs in place of graham, just because I needed to use them up. Ironed out great!
I halved the sugar and it was still pretty sweet other wise delicious!

My family has been making this cheese cake for over 30 years. It is still one of the favorites for a pot luck. Try blueberry or apple pie filling for a different taste. Make it faster with cool whip. Super easy, super tasty

I made this as written, as well as with the variations by jsracer in the reviews. The version by jsracer was amazing. The original recipe tasted just dreadful.

I really wanted to blame the weird after taste on the heavy cream and the fact that I don't often have cream, or maybe it was off? But I only opened the carton for this recipe, and I triple checked the best-before date - I had over a month left to use the cream.

I actually threw out the cheesecake - quite a feat for me. I don't want to risk doing that again so I'll just play it safe and stick with the condensed milk version of this recipe.

Everyone loves this dessert!! So quick to make too. I doubled the recipe. I love vanilla so I added 1/2 tsp to the graham crust and 3 tsp to the cream cheese/whipped cream mixture (doubled recipe). Otherwise everything was as is in recipe. The cream cheese/whip cream mixture had a distinct lemon taste without adding lemon juice...due to the extra tsp of vanilla?This recipe tastes better and lighter than the one I used to make with Cool Whip.
It was really easy to. Make. And tasted great
Absolutely Delicious!!!!!

It was so easy to do and it was absolutely delicious! Fluffy, light, and tasty! The only thing that I would do differently is that I would add a bit more butter/margarine to the crust in order to make it less crumbly. It was a challenge to remove it from the pan. Otherwise, it was perfect.
OMG!! Sooooo Good!! I added a teaspoon of lemon juice in with the cream cheese, otherwise I followed the recipe exactly

Yes. This has been a favorite birthday pie for fifty years.
We called cherry o cream cheese pie.we didnâ€™t use sugar, but used sweetened condensed milk. Added 1/4th lemon juice which is nevesseey to thicken the filling
Great easy recipe. Like mine slightly frozen. Yummy

This recipe surprised me at how easy it was to make. I didnâ€™t use canned topping because my family likes it plain. I would, however, be careful with overbearing the cream cheese because mine came out like whipped cheesecake instead of the classic, thick cream texture.
This is a really nice recipe for a no bake cheesecake. I made it as written and will be making it again and again. Everyone enjoyed it. Thanks for sharing your recipe. Yummy! >^..^

Was wonderful esp since I didn't have to start oven in warm weather. Put fresh blueberries and vanilla sugar on top since I didn't have any canned cherry filling. 

Was a little too liquidy. Next time I will add a little less cream. Thank for the recipe.

Itâ€™s absolutely delicious and easy! Since I donâ€™t care for pie filling Iâ€™ve topped it with a raspberry sauce and have also simply used frozen raspberries or frozen mixed fruit (raspberries, strawberries, blackberries & blueberries) to save time. I usually double the recipe and make it in a 13 x 9 pan for a lot of guests and/or leftovers! Always a hit ??
Terrible. Crust stuck to plate. Runny.
Was great! Family loved it!
Objectively this is lovely, but it's definitely sweeter than I was expecting. Next time I will cut the powdered sugar by about half. Otherwise, straightforward and tasty!

I've used this filling recipe time and time again for the past 5 years. It never disappoints. I've turned it in to cheesecakes, cheesecake shooters, cheesecake ice cream.. It's a winning recipe. People who aren't crazy about dry baked cheesecakes love this. I now make it several times a year for friends' Birthdays because it has become a favourite in my friend group. It's fantastic with any topping and any crust. Actually, one of my favourites was this layered with lemon curd inside a shortbread crust. Delicious.
Very easy to make. Tastes great. Iâ€™ll definitely make it again!!
I loved it! I was a little leary about the crust and almost put it in the oven but I didn't. It stayed together just fine. I'll definitely make more. Thank you.
This was the best Cherry Cheesecake I've ever had. Granted, I haven't had many but I made this yesterday and it was easy and delicious. I will definitely make this again.
Easiest best cheesecake ever! I also make this with blueberry pie filling which is if you are a blueberry lover.
This is more like a pie than a cheesecake to me, but still very yummy and super easy to make. Thanks!
The crust is not a very good recipe. It is too loose and a lot of it. Needs more butter. I would also bake and cool it before filling.
I have a similar recipe for a no-bake cheesecake. The only difference (and this is helpful for those bakers who don't normally stock heavy whipping cream) is to use a package of Dream Whip prepared.

What I particularly like about this recipe is that it is the perfect, basic platform for an icebox cheesecake and easy to get creative with. I had a little more than 8ozs of cream cheese left of a 3# block, so I added a little more powdered sugar. In addition to the vanilla extract, I added a little lemon extract to brighten it up. I didn't have heavy cream, but I had whipped topping. In it went. I have ripe peaches, so I'm going to grill them, slice them and top with them and a dollop of Cool Whip. This is the PERFECT fast go-to refrigerator cheese pie. Get creative!
I doubled the recipe and made it in a 9x11 inch pan. Turned out perfect!!

This cheesecake was so light, fluffy, and delicious! I put 4 stars because it took a while for my cake to become firm, and I had to put it in the freezer for about an hour. WARNING: Don't leave it on the counter! My poor cheesecake began to melt. Keep it refrigerated! Side note: I used vanilla graham crackers for the crust, it tasted amazing.

This turned out AMAZiNG I used an Oreo bottom crust and I was out of heavy cream so I used dream whip (added milk and light cream and whipped it then folded it in to the cream cheese mixture) because I used dream whip I reduced the icing sugar a bit it was fabulous and will be my go to recipe !!
Very easy to make and Delicious!! Next time will only use 3/4 cup of whipping cream to make cheesecake a little more solid.
One of the easiest desserts I've ever made - and it tastes so good! I did buy a pre-made crust though, but that's because it was Sunday and I was extra lazy.

Have made this recipe for years under the title of Cherry Delight. It's a staple for Christmas dessert in our house. It does help if you refrigerate this for a short period between adding layers. (ie) refrigerate briefly after making the crust then again after adding cream cheese mixture but before putting cherries on top. then finally adding cherries and refrigerating till it's done. It gives it a nicer, cleaner appearance.

This is so close to my recipe, instead of heavy cream I choose lite cool whip to cut the fat. Other than that this is dollar for dollar the same recipe I have been making for many years. My Aunt Francis made it first and I fell so in love with it I have been making it ever since.
great recipe! I used others suggestions and whipped the cream separately and added 2/3 cup sugar. I also made homemade cherry pie filling since it is cherry season. will definitely make again!

Modified this into a chocolate cheesecake by reducing the whipped cream to 1/2 cup and adding 1/2 cup of chocolate ganache (chocolate chips and 2% milk melted together). Very, very nice. This is my default cheesecake recipe from now on!

I don't care for cheesecake however, I needed a dessert to go with a dinner I was preparing for a close friend who had recently lost her mother and this pie turned out perfect! I used lite cream verses heavy and it set up great!

The first time I made this was about 2 weeks ago, a total runny mess! I didn't have heavy cream, so i looked up a substitute (butter&milk) for heavy cream and used it in place- what they failed to say was that for the substitute use for "cooking and baking" purposes only, not for "no bake" foods. Found that out on another site! As I said it turned into a runny mess that sat in our fridge for nearly a week!!! So today I made sure I had the heavy cream and I also kneaded the cream cheese and let sit out at room temp, before mixing (about 20-30 min). I added in 2tsp of lemon juice to aid in holding shape and 1 1/2 cream cheese, instead of the one. It held perfect form when putting into pre-made shell I will never make that mistake again! As for the taste - D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!!! Creamy and nicely formed to cut into.- very happy with this recipe, Thank you!
We cut the powdered sugar amount in half.
This is a favorite of mine and a huge hit to my kids and husband,
I put it into 24 125ml Mason jars and served at Christmas as individual servings. It was a hit.
My go-to recipe for dinner parties! Very good!
excellent and easy

I made 2 no bake cheesecakes for a get together last night, and this one was, no doubt, a million times easier than the other I chose to make. I followed the recipe exactly, and it was very sweet, as others have said, but it's cheesecake.. why would you expect anything else?! The only thing I changed was added 2 tsp of lemon juice to the filling, as another reviewer had recommended. The cheesecake was delicious! Everyone loved it, and there was no leftovers of this one by the end of the night. I'm not a big fan of cheesecake, or sweets really, but I had a hard time sticking to my "just one bite."

I used chocolate graham cracker crusted. Melted white chocolate on top of the crust before adding the cheesecake batter along with skme raspberries. Then after the batter i melted a light layer again of white chocolate with raspberry.

Like another reviewer I use condensed milk instead of the sugar/heavy cream combo. The splash of lemon juice is also a must I find. Sometimes I throw blueberry filling on top. 

The only other thing I would suggest, and it might not be for everyone, I like to pop my version in the freezer to make it nice and solid before cutting. Find it's easier to plate and easier to eat.
Definitely need to bake the graham cracker crust for 7 minutes. The crust fell apart while dishing it. It was very nice light pie. My son is making it today after having a piece on the 4 th of July.
